reviews.review_msg: too secure in his position to prepare/edit his "lectures."  usually just shows up and improvises around the readings.  sometimes works but...
The "Rick Coe 101" aspect happened in our class because few people did the readings.  I learned a lot, but his assignments were very unclear.

I found his good looks and smile really distracting in class. Class heavily relies on discussion, which is fun. He has a tendency to talk at length sometimes to a rambling point, and class attention would wane. Overall, fantastic, recommended for his Rhetoric class. He's a fair marker, clear about his expectations, and fun.

Peter is clearly passionate about the subject, but his lecture style isn't high energy, so don't expect that. It is geared toward class discussion, which is helpful. The readings are relevant and the papers can be sizable, but not difficult. Very helpful, approachable, clear and fair. Marking isn't easy, nor is it tough. Also kind of sexy.

I really enjoyed the MPub program at SFU, but this class was boring. The lack of clarity of ideas was hard to get through, even though I did pretty well. I do wish, however,  that there were less "comments" about how bad it is in the tech writing field. It makes those of us in it really uncomfortable.

An OK instructor. Easy-going and nice, though needs work on clarity and maybe explaining more about subject matter...sometimes confusing. This class was super boring though. Not what I expected at all from reading the course description.
